00043 
00044 /*
00045 Class: Songbird
00046 
00047 The Songbird object provides several pieces of functionality to your web page: playback,
00048 download, listener adding and removing and library creation and retrieval.
00049 
00050 This object provides you with functions that enable you to initiate playback
00051 of URL's, <MediaLists> and <WebPlaylists>. Basic playback control functions are also
00052 provided.
00053 
00054 The Songbird object provides download functionality as well. You may use it to download
00055 <MediaItems>, <MediaLists> and user selected items present in the <WebPlaylist>.
00056 
00057 The Songbird object is accessible (from Javascript) using the "songbird" global variable attached
00058 to the currently loaded document. See the example below.
00059 
00060 Example:
00061 (start code)
00062 //Get the currently playing artist.
00063 var artist = songbird.currentArtist;
00064 
00065 //Create default library with current domain and path automatically guessed.
00066 //This is the suggested way to create your site library.
00067 var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00068 
00069 ... // Look up the artist in your web service database
00070 ... // Find some samples by that artist.
00071 
00072 var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem(url);
00073 
00074 //Create a simple media list.
00075 var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00076 
00077 //Add a mediaitem to it.
00078 mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00079 
00080 //Play it.
00081 songbird.playMediaList(mediaList, 0);
00082 
00083 //You may also want to trigger a download to the users machine, for this mediaitem.
00084 songbird.downloadItem(mediaItem);
00085 (end)
00086 
00087 See Also:
00088   For more information about the <MediaItem> object, see the <MediaItem> reference.
00089   For more information about the <MediaList> object, see the <MediaList> reference.
00090   For more information about the <WebPlaylist> object, see the <WebPlaylist> reference.
00091 */
00099 [scriptable, uuid(40964944-5243-4a16-886b-14c1cbaa79d9)]

00170   /*
00171   Prop: playing
00172 
00173   This is the playing state of the application. If stopped this will be false,
00174   otherwise this will be true. If the application is paused this will be true
00175   so for a complete status you need to check the paused state as well.
00176 
00177   Type:
00178     boolean
00179   */
00180   readonly attribute boolean playing;
00181 
00189   /*
00190   Prop: paused
00191 
00192   This is the pause state of the application. This will be true if the
00193   application has been paused during playback. It will be false if not
00194   paused or stopped.
00195 
00196   Type:
00197     boolean
00198   */
00199   readonly attribute boolean paused;
00200 
00210   /*
00211   Prop: repeat
00212 
00213   The repeat state for playback. This can be one of three values:
00214     0 - no repeat
00215     1 - repeat the current track forever
00216     2 - repeat the current playlist forever
00217 
00218   Type:
00219     integer
00220   */
00221   readonly attribute long long repeat;

00230   Prop: shuffle

00233   false otherwise.

00235   Type:
00236     boolean
00237   */
00238   readonly attribute boolean shuffle;

00380   /*
00381   Prop: downloadMediaList
00382 
00383   This <MediaList> is the list that gets all the <MediaItems>s that get
00384   added throught the 3 download methods. If the user has enabled downloading,
00385   tracks can be added to this playlist directly in order to begin downloads.
00386 
00387   Type:
00388     <MediaList>
00389 
00390   Example:
00391     (start code)
00392     // Get the download media list
00393     var dlList = songbird.downloadMediaList;
00394     (end)
00395   
00396   See Also:
00397     <downloadItem()>
00398     <downloadList()>
00399     <downloadSelected()>
00400   */
00401 
00402   readonly attribute sbIRemoteMediaList downloadMediaList;

00411   /*
00412   Method: addListener()
00413 
00414   Add a listener to get notified of changes to Songbird metadata and state.
00415 
00416   Prototype:
00417     addListener(String key, Object listener)
00418 
00419   Parameters:
00420     key - The key for the metadata or state value.
00421     listener - The listener that will get called when the metadata or state value specified by the key changes.
00422 
00423   Example:
00424     (start code)
00425     //Make a listener object. The listener must always have at least this function.
00426 
00427     //You may add any number of functions and properties to it for your own use.
00428 
00429     //Make sure to save this object somewhere so you may unregister it when you are done
00430     //listening for changes.
00431     var listener = {
00432       observer: function(subject, topic, data) {
00433       }
00434     }
00435 
00436     var key = "metadata.genre";
00437 
00438     songbird.addListener(key, listener);
00439 
00440     ...
00441 
00442     songbird.removeListener(key, listener);
00443     (end)
00444 
00445   See Also:
00446     <removeListener()>
00447 
00448     Visit <Listener Topics> for a list of keys for metadata and state.
00449 
00450     Visit <http://www.xulplanet.com/references/xpcomref/ifaces/nsIObserver.html> for nsIObserver interface reference.
00451   */
00452   void addListener( in AString aKey,
00453                     in nsIObserver aObserver );
00454 
00459   /*
00460   Method: removeListener()
00461 
00462   Remove a listener that was previously added using <addListener>.
00463 
00464   Prototype:
00465     removeListener(String key, Object listener)
00466 
00467   Parameters:
00468     key - The key for the metadata or state value.
00469     listener - The listener that was previously added using <addListener>.
00470 
00471   Example:
00472     (start code)
00473     //This example assumes there was a listener object named 'listener' that was previously
00474     //created and added using the key 'metadata.genre'.
00475 
00476     ...
00477 
00478     var key = "metadata.genre";
00479     songbird.removeListener(key, listener);
00480     (end)
00481 
00482   See Also:
00483     <addListener()>
00484   */
00485   void removeListener( in AString aKey,
00486                        in nsIObserver aObserver );
00487 
00491   /*
00492   Method: downloadItem()
00493 
00494   Download a <MediaItem>. <MediaList>s and <Library>ies not allowed.
00495 
00496   Prototype:
00497     downloadItem(<MediaItem> mediaItem)
00498 
00499   Parameters:
00500     mediaItem - The <MediaItem> to download.
00501 
00502   Example:
00503     (start code)
00504     //Create or get library.
00505     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00506 
00507     //Create the mediaitem.
00508     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00509 
00510     //Download the mediaitem to the users local machine.
00511     songbird.downloadItem(mediaItem);
00512     (end)
00513 
00514   See Also:
00515     <downloadList()>
00516     <downloadSelected()>
00517   */
00518   void downloadItem( in sbIMediaItem aItem );
00519 
00524   /*
00525   Method: downloadList()
00526 
00527   Download a <MediaList>. As <Library>ies are <MediaList>s they are
00528   allowed here.
00529 
00530   Prototype:
00531     downloadList(<MediaList> mediaList)
00532 
00533   Parameters:
00534     mediaList - The <MediaList> to download.
00535 
00536   Example:
00537     (start code)
00538     //Create or get site library.
00539     var library = songbird.siteLibrary("", "");
00540 
00541     //Create mediaitem.
00542     var mediaItem = library.createMediaItem("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00543 
00544     //Create medialist to download.
00545     var mediaList = library.createMediaList("simple");
00546 
00547     //Add item to medialist.
00548     mediaList.add(mediaItem);
00549 
00550     //Download the medialist.
00551     songbird.downloadList(mediaList);
00552     (end)
00553 
00554   See Also:
00555     <downloadItem()>
00556     <downloadSelected()>
00557   */
00558   void downloadList( in sbIRemoteMediaList aList );
00559 
00564   /*
00565   Method: downloadSelected()
00566 
00567   Download the <MediaItems> selected by the user in a <WebPlaylist>.
00568 
00569   Prototype:
00570     downloadSelected(<WebPlaylist> webPlaylist)
00571 
00572   Parameters:
00573     webPlaylist - The <WebPlaylist> from which to download the selected <MediaItems>.
00574 
00575   Example:
00576     (start code)
00577     //Download the mediaitems currently selected by the user in
00578     //the current webplaylist.
00579 
00580     songbird.downloadSelected(songbird.webPlaylist);
00581     (end)
00582 
00583   See Also:
00584     <downloadItem()>

00586   */

00593   /*
00594   Method: play()
00595 
00596   Prototype:
00597     play()
00598 
00599   Begin playback at the current location in the <WebPlaylist>.
00600 
00601   Example:
00602     (start code)
00603     songbird.play();
00604     (end)
00605 
00606   Note:
00607     Metadata for the <MediaItems> may get updated and overwritten during playback.
00608     See <Metadata Updates> for more details about cases where metadata may 
00609     get updated.
00610 
00611   See Also:
00612     <playURL()>
00613     <playMediaList()>
00614     <pause()>
00615     <stop()>
00616     <previous()>
00617     <next()>
00618   */
00619   void play();
00620 
00621   /*
00622   Method: playMediaList()
00623 
00624   Begin playback of a <MediaList> at the specified index in the list.
00625 
00626   Prototype:
00627     playMediaList(<MediaList> mediaList, Number index)
00628 
00629   Parameters:
00630     mediaList - The <MediaList> to play.
00631     index - Where to start playing in the list. Index starts at 0.
00632 
00633   Example:
00634     (start code)
00635     //Songbird object implements Player.
00636     //Play the media list, starting with item at index 2.
00637 
00638     player.playMediaList(mediaList, 2);
00639     (end)
00640 
00641   Note:
00642     Metadata for <MediaItems> may get updated and overwritten during playback.
00643     See <Metadata Updates> for more details about cases where metadata may 
00644     get updated.
00645 
00646   See Also:
00647     <play()>
00648     <playURL()>
00649     <pause()>
00650     <stop()>
00651     <previous()>
00652     <next()>
00653   */
00654   void playMediaList( in sbIRemoteMediaList aList,
00655                       in PRInt32 aIndex );
00656

00662   Method: playURL()
00663 
00664   Begin playback of a URL.
00665 
00666   Prototype:
00667     playURL(String url)
00668 
00669   Parameters:
00670     url - The URL to play.
00671 
00672   Example:
00673     (start code)
00674     songbird.playURL("http://path/to/item.mp3");
00675     (end)
00676 
00677   Note:
00678     Metadata for the <MediaItem> associated with this URL may get updated 
00679     and overwritten during playback. See <Metadata Updates> for more details 
00680     about cases where metadata may get updated.
00681 
00682   See Also:
00683     <play()>
00684     <playMediaList()>
00685     <pause()>
00686     <stop()>
00687     <previous()>
00688     <next()>
00689   */

00750   /*
00751   Method: next()
00752 
00753   Skip to the next item, if there is one, and begin playing.
00754 
00755   If there is no next item playback will continue until the
00756   end of the current item.
00757 
00758   Prototype:
00759     next()
00760 
00761   Example:
00762     (start code)
00763     songbird.next();
00764     (end)
00765 
00766   See Also:
00767     <play()>
00768     <playURL()>
00769     <playMediaList()>
00770     <pause()>
00771     <stop()>
00772     <previous()>
00773   */
00774   void next();
00775 
00780   /*
00781   Method: previous()
00782 
00783   Skip to the previous item, if there is one, and begin playing.
00784 
00785   If there is no previous item playback will continue until the of the current item.
00786 
00787   Prototype:
00788     previous()
00789 
00790   Example:
00791     (start code)
00792     songbird.previous();
00793     (end)
00794 
00795   See Also:
00796     <play()>
00797     <playURL()>
00798     <playMediaList()>
00799     <pause()>
00800     <stop()>
00801     <next()>
00802   */
00803   void previous();
00804 
00805   /*
00806   Method: setSiteScope()
00807   
00808   Set the scope for which to access site-specific privilegs such as the <siteLibrary>.
00809   By default, the page's current domain and path is used.
00810   Use an empty string for the domain and the path to use the default values.
00811   
00812   Note:
00813     This may not be called more than once, and not after accessing the <siteLibrary>.
00814     Accessing <siteLibrary> without calling <setSiteScope()> defaults to the most
00815     restrictive scope possible (i.e. full host name, deepest path).
00816   
00817   Prototype:
00818     setSiteScope(String domain, String path)
00819   
00820   Parameters:
00821     domain - The domain name of the library. This may be an empty string.
00822     path - The path within the domain for the library. This may be an empty string.
00823 
00824   Example:
00825     (start code)
00826     // sets the site scope to TLD+1 (will throw unless the page was on *.example.com)
00827     songbird.setSiteScope("example.com", "");
00828     // sets the site scope to default values
00829     // (will throw because it has already been set once)
00830     songbird.setSiteScope("", "");
00831     (end)
00832   
00833   See Also:
00834     <siteLibrary>
00835   */
00836   void setSiteScope(in AUTF8String aDomain, in AUTF8String aPath);
00837 
00838   /*
00839   Method: libraries()
00840 
00841   Access to any library in the system via path or 'magic' keyword.
00842 
00843   Prototype:
00844     libraries(String libraryID)
00845 
00846   Parameters:
00847     libraryID - Library ID you wish to access, this can be a path or 'magic' keyword.
00848                 Currently supported keywords are "main" and "web".
00849 
00850   Example:
00851     (start code)
00852     var libraryID = "web";
00853     var library = songbird.libraries(libraryID);
00854     (end)
00855 
00856   See Also:
00857     <siteLibrary>
00858   */
00859   sbIRemoteLibrary libraries(in AString aLibraryID);

00864   [noscript] void fireEventToContent(in AString aClass, in AString aType);

00869   [noscript] void onCommandsChanged();
00870 
00871   /*
00872   Func: createTextProperty()
00873 
00874   Add a text property to the system that will be available for all media items.
00875   Properties define the set of possible columns available to the <WebPlaylist>
00876 
00877   Prototype:
00878     createTextProperty(in AString ID, in AString displayName,
00879                        in boolean userViewable, in boolean userEditable,
00880                        in unsigned long nullSort)
00881 
00882   Parameters:
00883     ID - A unique text id of the new property.
00884     displayName - The displayed name of the property
00885     userViewable - property can be viewed by the user.
00886     userEditable - property values can be edited by the user.
00887     nullSort - The type of null sorting desired.
00888 
00889   Null Sorting Types:
00890     0 - Null values are infinitely small.  This is the default.
00891     1 - Null values are infinitely large.
00892     2 - Null values are always first (regardless of sort direction)
00893     3 - Null values are always last
00894 
00895   Example:
00896     (start code)
00897     //This example assumes you already have created
00898     //a mediaitem and assigned it to mediaItem.
00899 
00900     // Create a property that indicates what store this item is from
00901     songbird.createDateTimeProperty("Store", "Store", true, false, 0);
00902 
00903     // Add the store name to the media item
00904     mediaitem.setProperty("Store", "Amazon");
00905     (end)
00906 
00907   See Also:
00908     <createDateTimeProperty>
00909     <createURIProperty>
00910     <createNumberProperty>
00911     <createImageProperty>
00912     <createRatingsProperty>
00913     <createButtonProperty>
00914     <createDownloadButtonProperty>
00915   */
00916   void createTextProperty( in AString ID,
00917                            in AString displayName,
00918                            in boolean userViewable,
00919                            in boolean userEditable,
00920                            in unsigned long nullSort );
00921 
00922   /*
00923   Func: createDateTimeProperty()
00924 
00925   Add a date time property to the system that will be available for all media
00926   items.
00927   Properties define the set of possible columns available to the <WebPlaylist>
00928 
00929   Prototype:
00930     createDateTimeProperty(in AString ID, in AString displayName,
00931                            in boolean userViewable, in boolean userEditable,
00932                            in unsigned long nullSort)
00933 
00934   Parameters:
00935     ID - A unique text id of the new property.
00936     displayName - The displayed name of the property
00937     userViewable - property can be viewed by the user.
00938     userEditable - property values can be edited by the user.
00939     nullSort - The type of null sorting desired.
00940 
00941   Null Sorting Types:
00942     0 - Null values are infinitely small.  This is the default.
00943     1 - Null values are infinitely large.
00944     2 - Null values are always first (regardless of sort direction)
00945     3 - Null values are always last
00946 
00947   Example:
00948     (start code)
00949     //This example assumes you already have created
00950     //a mediaitem and assigned it to mediaItem.
00951 
00952     // Create a property of when this item was added to the store
00953     songbird.createDateTimeProperty("DateAdded", "Added", true, false, 0);
00954 
00955     // Add the added date to the media item
00956     mediaitem.setProperty("DateAdded", "4948575738");
00957     (end)
00958 
00959   See Also:
00960     <createTextProperty>
00961     <createURIProperty>
00962     <createNumberProperty>
00963     <createImageProperty>
00964     <createRatingsProperty>
00965     <createButtonProperty>
00966     <createDownloadButtonProperty>
00967   */
00968   void createDateTimeProperty( in AString ID,
00969                                in AString displayName,
00970                                in boolean userViewable,
00971                                in boolean userEditable,

00974   /*
00975   Func: createURIProperty()
00976 
00977   Add a URI property to the system that will be available for all media items.
00978   Properties define the set of possible columns available to the <WebPlaylist>
00979 
00980   Prototype:
00981     createURIProperty(in AString ID, in AString displayName,
00982                       in boolean userViewable, in boolean userEditable,
00983                       in unsigned long nullSort)
00984 
00985   Parameters:
00986     ID - A unique text id of the new property.
00987     displayName - The displayed name of the property
00988     userViewable - property can be viewed by the user.
00989     userEditable - property values can be edited by the user.
00990     nullSort - The type of null sorting desired.
00991 
00992   Null Sorting Types:
00993     0 - Null values are infinitely small.  This is the default.
00994     1 - Null values are infinitely large.
00995     2 - Null values are always first (regardless of sort direction)
00996     3 - Null values are always last
00997 
00998   Example:
00999     (start code)
01000     //This example assumes you already have created
01001     //a mediaitem and assigned it to mediaItem.
01002 
01003     // Create a property that links to the store
01004     songbird.createURIProperty("StoreLink", "Store", true, false, 0);
01005 
01006     // Add a url to the media item
01007     mediaitem.setProperty("StoreLink", "http://www.store.com/item.php?id=1");
01008     (end)
01009 
01010   See Also:
01011     <createTextProperty>
01012     <createDateTimeProperty>
01013     <createNumberProperty>
01014     <createImageProperty>
01015     <createRatingsProperty>
01016     <createButtonProperty>
01017     <createDownloadButtonProperty>
01018   */
01019   void createURIProperty( in AString ID,
01020                           in AString displayName,
01021                           in boolean userViewable,
01022                           in boolean userEditable,
01023                           in unsigned long nullSort );
